Mamoswine is an effective wallbreaker on Ice teams, as it helps pressure Fire-, Rock-, and Steel-types such as Torkoal, Tyranitar, and Heatran. Earthquake makes it a dangerous threat for Poison and Electric teams, and Icicle Crash hits Ground-immune targets like Celesteela, Zapdos, and Mantine. Ice Shard provides priority and aids in revenge killing the likes of Agility Galarian Moltres, Choice Scarf Galarian Zapdos, and Choice Scarf Thundurus-T. Superpower grants Mamoswine the ability to break past bulky Pokemon such as Ferrothorn and Porygon2. Heavy Slam can be used to reliably defeat setup sweepers such as Hatterene and Clefable. Knock Off is a great utility option that allows Mamoswine to get rid of important items such as Eviolite from Chansey, Porygon2, and Piloswine as well as recovery items from Ferrothorn and Slowbro. An Adamant nature lets Mamoswine better revenge kill the aforementioned targets of Ice Shard.

Kyurem appreciates Mamoswine breaking through Steel-types such as Aegislash and Melmetal, as they are able to tank Kyurem's Earth Powers quite easily. In return, Kyurem checks Rotom-W and Slowbro and is capable of PP stalling Ferrothorn's Gyro Ball and Corviknight's Body Press with Pressure. Arctozolt not only helps Mamoswine break down defensive cores used by Poison and Flying teams, but also threatens Water-types such as Pelipper, Volcanion, and Toxapex. Cloyster values Mamoswines immunity to Electric-type moves from Tapu Koko, Zapdos, and Alolan Raichu, while also setting Spikes to support Mamoswine's wallbreaking by providing chip damage against foes. Aurora Veil Alolan Ninetales allows Mamoswine to tank more hits and wallbreak for a prolonged period of time; Alolan Ninetales also checks threats such as Urshifu-R and Kommo-o. Galarian Darmanitan can use Flare Blitz to KO Ferrothorn for non-Superpower Mamoswine and also lures Ground-immune Steel-types like Corviknight and Celesteela. Mamoswine wears down bulky teams so that Weavile can sweep in the late-game, while Weavile's Speed is great for dealing with faster threats such as Volcarona, Spectrier, and Blacephalon.

Froslass.comments:
Other Options

Ghost

Froslass can run dual screens with Light Clay to make setup easier for teammates, but the Spikes support is useful in more instances. Ice Beam and Triple Axel can be considered over Icy Wind for the Flying matchup since Spikes is useless there. Ice Beam OHKOes Landorus-T, while Triple Axel does huge damage to Galarian Moltres.

Suicide Lead (Ghost).description:
Froslass's high speed makes it a particularly effective user of Spikes, always getting at least one layer up when teams lack a faster Pokémon. Spikes allows Froslass to pressure opposing teams by punishing switching, and wearing down opposing Pokemon. Taunt ensures that Defog users like Rotom-H, Volcanion and Corviknight, will not be able remove the Spikes, as well as blocking entry hazards and status from the likes of Ferrothorn and Toxapex. Icy Wind offers Froslass valuable speed control, ensuring that setup sweepers like Volcarona can't use it as setup fodder, and also allows Froslass to bring down faster targets with Destiny Bond the following turn. Destiny Bond also pairs well with Taunt, since Taunt forces foes to attack Froslass directly. Will-O-Wisp is also an option as it cripples Pokemon like Bisharp and Tyranitar that could play around Destiny Bond. Cursed Body can potentially cripple Choice-Locked Pokemon like Weavile and Zarude, giving its teammates the opportunity to set up.

Offensive Pokemon like Gengar, Dragapult, Spectrier, Mimikyu, and Blacephalon appreciate the Froslass’s Spikes support, which allows them to KO foes more easily. For example, Gengar can benefit from Spikes wearing away at Specially Defensive Tyranitar to the point that Focus Blast can KO it. Blacephalon and Spectrier benefit from Spikes wearing their checks like Drapion and Heatran allowing them to sweep Poison and Steel teams late-game. Spectrier also appreciates Will-O-Wisp Froslass spreading burns in the opposing teams if running Hex. Dragapult, Mimikyu, and Aegislash appreciate Spikes support to overwhelm physically defensive Pokémon such as Toxapex, Ferrothorn, and Hippowdon. Aegislash deals with Clefable and Hatterene which are unaffected by Spikes. Runerigus forms an entry hazard-stacking core with Froslass, with the former providing Stealth Rock and Toxic Spikes

Suicide Lead (Ice).description:
Froslass is able to make a great suicide lead thanks to its high Speed stat and is great for its access to entry hazards, Taunt, and Destiny Bond. Spikes are great to pressure switch-ins and get chip damage on the opponent's Pokemon. Taunt enable Froslass to shut down other Pokemon from getting up Stealth Rock, Toxic Spikes, or Spikes. Destiny Bond can be used to take down a Pokemon with it. Shadow Ball allows Froslass to 2HKO Hatterene that would otherwise bounce Spikes back. Froslass should be used as a lead most of the time to get up Spikes and try to take a Pokemon down with it with Destiny Bond. It can also be saved for later in the game to stop common Rapid Spin users such as Excadrill from getting rid of Spikes thanks to its Ghost typing.

Stealth Rock setters such as Mamoswine and Piloswine work great with Froslass to form an entry hazard-stacking duo to pressure Pokemon from being able to switch in and out, as well as making it easier for Cloyster and Weavile to sweep. Wallbreakers and setup sweepers such as Mamoswine, Kyurem-B and Cloyster appreciate Froslass's Spikes to chip down the opposing team and make them easier to get rid of. However, Froslass will struggle to set up Spikes later in the game if there are entry hazards down that can break its Focus Sash, so partners such as Avalugg and Galarian Mr. Mime go well with it. Froslass also struggles against Pokemon that can attack and KO it with priority moves like Aegislash, so partners such as Galarian Darmanitan and Lapras are needed, as they can take care of it.

Substitute + Nasty Plot (Electric).description:
Rotom-H is a good option on Electric teams because of its ability to hit Grass- and Steel-type Pokemon such as Celebi, Vileplume, and Ferrothorn for super effective damage with Overheat. Being able to take down Steel-type Pokemon is especially important, as Overheat in the Steel matchup can be otherwise hard due to its defensive core as well as revenge killers in Excadrill. Nasty Plot and Substitute in conjunction with its good Special Attack and decent Speed allows Rotom-H to serve as a setup sweeper and wallbreaker, being great against Steel teams as well as other types like Grass, Ice, and Psychic. Nasty Plot helps Rotom-H break past bulkier Pokemon such as Mew, Galarian Corsola, and Celebi as well as OHKO offensive Pokemon such as Gardevoir, Hatterene, and Kyurem-B with a boosted Overheat. Substitute allows Rotom-H to set up on more passive defensive Pokemon, mainly Ferrothorn, Celebi and Appletun, or forced switches. Against Steel, Rotom-H should look to set up Substitute against Ferrothorn in order to beat more Pokemon with Overheat. Substitute is also good because it enables Rotom-H to set up in front of Bisharp's Sucker Punch and force Aegislash to change to Blade forme to take it on, allowing Rotom-H to deal with these Pokemon more consistently especially against Steel teams. Thunderbolt hits Pokemon such as Toxapex and Corviknight for super effective damage while OHKOing Pokemon such as Indeedee and Gengar after a Nasty Plot boost without having to rely on Overheat along with its Special Attack drops. Maximum Speed combined with a Timid nature allows Rotom-H to outspeed Pokemon like Indeedee-F, Mamoswine, and Diggersby as well as other Pokemon like Choice Scarf Duraludon if Sticky Web is set.

The entirety of Electric teams appreciates Rotom-H's ability to beat Steel teams effectively. Galvantula and Vikavolt set Sticky Web for Rotom-H, allowing it to outspeed Pokemon such as Choice Scarf Duraludon, Choice Scarf Gardevoir, and Salazzle. Alolan Raichu is a good revenge killer under Electric Terrain, being able to take on Pokemon such as Seismitoad, Terrakion, and Choice Scarf Excadrill, which check Rotom-H. The latter is extremely important, as it can beat Rotom-H with Earthquake if it is not behind a Substitute. Pincurchin sets Spikes and Toxic Spikes, wearing down the opposing team for Rotom-H, and can slow down Pokemon like Gengar with Thunder Wave and give Rotom-H setup opportunities with Memento. Zeraora is a great physical wallbreaker, being able to take on special walls like Snorlax and Tyranitar with its high Attack paired with Choice Band as well as Dragon-type Pokemon like Dragapult, Hydreigon, and Dracovish with Play Rough. In return, Rotom-H can break past a lot of the Pokemon Zeraora struggles with such as Galarian Corsola, Torkoal, and Vileplume with Nasty Plot. Toxtricity is another special sweeper with Shift Gear that works together with Rotom-H to take on types like Psychic, Grass, Fairy, Ice, and Poison. Morpeko can break dual screens using Psychic Fangs to help Rotom-H wallbreak and bring Rotom-H in safely using Parting Shot. It can also beat Pokemon like Gastrodon and Seismitoad with Seed Bomb for Rotom-H.

Status Utility (Electric).description:
Rotom-W serves as the primary defensive Pokemon on Electric-type teams, taking advantage of its part Water typing to take on threatening Pokemon like Barraskewda and Galarian Darmanitan. In addition, its ability Levitate enables Rotom-W to act as the primary check to Ground-types. Will-O-Wisp is good for burning physical attackers such as Bisharp and Mimikyu while Toxic is important for allowing Rotom-W to beat Pokemon such as Seismitoad and Gastrodon that would wall it otherwise, making it even better against Ground teams. Volt Switch enables Rotom-W to act as a slow pivot for the team in order to bring in teammates safely.

Due to Levitate and Volt Switch, nearly every Electric-type Pokemon greatly benefits from Rotom-W's presence on a team. Specifically, Toxtricity and Zeraora greatly appreciate Rotom-W's ability to serve as a defensive pivot by using Volt Switch to bring them in safely. Rotom-W also pairs well with Vikavolt, which provides a secondary Ground-type immunity. Heliolisk can also pair well with Rotom-W due to its immunity to Water-type attacks, which also relieves the pressure from Rotom-W to deal with strong Water-type Pokemon. In addition, Heliolisk's coverage moves also helps deal with Ground-types, further relieving pressure from Rotom-W.

Nasty Plot + Substitute (Water).description:
Rotom-W is a decent setup sweeper on Water teams thanks to its access to Nasty Plot in tandem with Substitute. Substitute allows Rotom-W to set up on more passive Pokemon such as Toxapex, Pelipper, Mandibuzz, and Jellicent, posing a huge threat to types such as Water, Ghost, and Dark. Thunderbolt and Hydro Pump are Rotom-W's STAB moves, with Hydro Pump being especially strong under rain. Thunderbolt hits everything on Water bar Seismitoad and the uncommon Gastrodon, and Hydro Pump beats them both if they are Swift Swim and Sticky Hold, respectively. Dark Pulse is an alternative option over Hydro Pump in order to hit Pokemon such as Celebi, Seismitoad, and Ferrothorn. Generally, Rotom-W should try to look for opportunities to punch holes in the opposition early- to mid-game for other sweepers like Barraskewda and Seismitoad to sweep late-game, since Rotom-W won't be sweeping by itself most of the time. A Timid nature along with maximum Speed investment is used to outspeed Pokemon such as Gyarados and Togekiss that can be problematic to deal with otherwise.

Pelipper's Drizzle is great for boosting Rotom-W's Hydro Pump, and Pelipper can bring in Rotom-W safely with U-turn. Keldeo primarily is an amazing partner for Rotom-W because it can beat Pokemon like Ferrothorn and Hydreigon that would otherwise be problematic, while Keldeo appreciates Rotom-W's ability to beat Flying-type Pokemon such as Togekiss and Corviknight for it. Other offensive Pokemon like Seismitoad, Barraskewda, and Choice Scarf Dracovish appreciate Rotom-W's role as a early- to mid-game wallbreaker in order to sweep teams late-game. Rotom-W also appreciates said Pokemon to beat Pokemon that it can't, such as Ferrothorn, while outspeeding faster Pokemon such as Indeedee, Hydreigon, and Dragapult. Toxapex is a good partner for Rotom-W because of its access to Toxic Spikes, which helps with types such as Normal, Psychic, and Fairy. Toxapex is also great as a defensive pivot, being able to switch into attacks such as Ferrothorn's Power Whip for Rotom-W. Araquanid is a good partner for Rotom-W because of its ability to set Sticky Web and slow down faster Pokemon such as Mew, Indeedee, and Choice Scarf Gardevoir for it to outspeed. It can also threaten Celebi with Leech Life.

Defensive Defog (Water).description:
Rotom-W's good bulk coupled with its defensive typing and access to Volt Switch makes it a good defensive pivot and Defog user on Water teams. Defog prevents the team from being overwhelmed with entry hazards, especially Spikes and Sticky Web; Levitate is especially great with Defog, as it allows Rotom-W to avoid all hazards bar Stealth Rock. Spikes is obnoxious to deal with because it chips almost all of Rotom-W's teammates down, and Sticky Web slows down offensive Pokemon such as Barraskewda, Dracovish, Keldeo, and Seismitoad, making sweeping relatively harder. Will-O-Wisp is used to cripple physical attackers such as Bisharp and Mimikyu, while Thunder Wave can be used to slow down faster Pokemon such as Gardevoir, Duraludon and Dragapult for the team. Volt Switch should be used liberally to grab momentum, whether against Pokemon Rotom-W can't outright beat such as Reuniclus and Snorlax, faster Pokemon, or forced switches. Rotom-W should generally look for opportunities to pivot into resisted attacks such as Seismitoad's Hydro Pump and Togekiss's Air Slash so it can use Defog safety and grab momentum. However, it does lack a form of reliable recovery, so be careful when switching it into stronger attacks and preserve its HP.

The entire Water team appreciates Rotom-W's ability to remove hazards. Pokemon such as Pelipper and Toxapex in particular hate getting chipped by Stealth Rock and Spikes, as it limits their ability to switch in and do their job well. Offensive Pokemon such as Keldeo, Crawdaunt, Dracovish, Barraskewda, and Cloyster also hate taking chip damage and struggle with Sticky Web, as they rely on their Speed stats to consistently threaten the opposing team. Rotom-W can also pivot into stronger attacks for the aforementioned offensive Pokemon and can use Volt Switch in order to grab momentum, giving them a safe switch. In return, many of these offensive Pokemon can use the safe switch in to beat Pokemon that Rotom-W can't such as Ferrothorn, Indeedee, Hydreigon, and Dragapult. Rotom-W appreciates Pokemon such as Dracovish, Pelipper, Seismitoad, and Mantine, as they are able to threaten Celebi for it. Toxapex is a good defensive Pokemon that pairs well with Rotom-W because of its ability to absorb status from Pokemon such as Drapion and Mandibuzz, and it can pivot into stronger attacks such as Roserade's Leaf Storm and Lucario's Focus Blast for Rotom-W. It can also use Haze to prevent setup sweepers such as Hydreigon and Reuniclus from getting out of hand.

Nasty Plot + Substitute (Electric).description:
Rotom-C is a good option on Electric teams because its Grass typing along with its access to a powerful STAB move in Leaf Storm makes it a reliable answer to the many Ground-type Pokemon that Electric teams dislike dealing with. Pokemon such as Hippowdon, Seismitoad, and Gastrodon are all easily set up on by Rotom-C, and other Pokemon such as Mamoswine and Excadrill have trouble revenge killing it due to Substitute. Nasty Plot allows Rotom-C to serve as a setup sweeper by beating Pokemon such as Hatterene, Bisharp, and Excadrill after a boost, while Substitute also allows it to set up on status users such as Seismitoad, Pokemon that are unable to deal significant damage to Rotom-C such as Toxapex, and forced switches, as well as helping against Bisharp's Sucker Punch. Thunderbolt is valuable coverage that hits Pokemon such as Corviknight and Toxapex for super effective damage, as well as Pokemon like Aegislash, Bisharp, Jirachi, Salazzle, and Galarian Weezing neutrally. Leaf Storm is Rotom-C's stronger STAB attack that hits the aforementioned Ground-type Pokemon and can beat bulkier Pokemon, such as Mew, Hatterene, and Gardevoir, with a Nasty Plot boost. Although its bulk is not the best, Rotom-C can serve as an answer to certain offensive Pokemon using its typing, such as Barraskewda and Seismitoad under rain, but shouldn't set up on other hard-hitting offensive Pokemon such as Indeedee and Dragapult that threaten to OHKO or heavily dent it.

The entirety of Electric appreciates Rotom-C's ability to serve as a reliable answer to Ground-type Pokemon, seeing as Electric teams struggle immensely against them otherwise. In return, Sticky Web setters such as Galvantula and Vikavolt are good partners for Rotom-C, as they patch up its middling Speed and allow it to outspeed Pokemon such as Choice Specs Indeedee, Choice Scarf Gardevoir, Choice Specs Gengar, and Mimikyu, paving the way for it to sweep. Choice Band Zeraora is a fantastic wallbreaker that can take on faster Pokemon such as Hydreigon, Cinderace, and Dragapult and forms an offensive core with Rotom-C. Zeraora's ability to wallbreak early-game and beat Dragon- and Steel-type Pokemon with Play Rough, Plasma Fists, and Close Combat is fantastic for Rotom-C to sweep weakened teams or vice versa. Toxtricity is another special attacker that can beat Grass-type Pokemon such as Whimsicott, Vileplume, and Roserade for Rotom-C. Alolan Raichu is a powerful wallbreaker that can outspeed and beat threats such as Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan, Choice Scarf Gengar, and Choice Scarf Excadrill for Rotom-C under Electric Terrain. Pincurchin can set up Spikes and Toxic Spikes as well as use Memento to weaken the opponent and bring Rotom-C in for it to set up and sweep. Morpeko is amazing against Psychic and Ghost teams and can bring Rotom-C in with Parting Shot while the stat drops help it set up. Morpeko can also break screens, which limit Rotom-C’s sweeping potential, with Psychic Fangs.

Nasty Plot (Grass).description:
Rotom-C's useful Electric typing, access to Nasty Plot, good Special Attack, and average Speed stat allow it to help out greatly with Flying-types and become a fearsome setup sweeper. Nasty Plot allows Rotom-C to net OHKOs against bulkier Water- and Flying-types such as Toxapex and Corviknight. Use Substitute on passive Pokemon such as Ferrothorn and Toxapex to avoid status and set up with Nasty Plot. Thunderbolt makes Rotom-C able to take on Flying-types such as Corviknight and Mandibuzz. Dark Pulse is used for neutral damage and greatly helping with Ferrothorn, Seismitoad, and Excadrill and Ghost- and Psychic-types like Aegislash and Celebi. Maximum HP makes it easier for Rotom-C to keep its Substitute while setting up on Ferrothorn, while maximum Speed with a Timid nature allows Rotom-C to outpace Togekiss.

Rotom-C's teammates appreciate its ability to be able to threaten Flying-types such as Pelipper and Corviknight. Rotom-C loves entry hazard setters such as Ferrothorn and Roserade to sweep more easily mid- to late-game and in particular likes Ferrothorn thanks to its Steel typing allowing it to come in on Ice-type attacks. Appletun forms a good defensive core with Ferrothorn because its Dragon typing and Thick Fat makes it able to come in on Fire-type attacks from Pokemon like Dragapult and Charizard. Virizion makes a great partner due to its ability to take on Charizard and Centiskorch with Stone Edge, OHKO Alolan Ninetales with Smart Strike and Steel-type Pokemon like Excadrill. Leech Seed users such as Ferrothorn, Appletun, and Whimsicott are good partners for Rotom-C, as they wear down opposing Pokemon for it while helping it set up by providing it with more passive recovery. Whimsicott can be used for its Substitute + Leech Seed to chip Pokemon down and make it easier for Rotom-C to clean up. Whimsicott's Fairy typing and access to Moonblast also help greatly in the Dragon- and the Dark-type matchup with pressuring and taking care of Hydreigon and Grimmsnarl. Whimsicott can also use Heat Rock and Sunny Day to make Venusaur and Celebi turn into dangerous sweepers that greatly help in the Steel-type matchup, taking care of Pokemon that Rotom-C has trouble with such as Duraludon with Growth-boosted Weather Ball or Nasty Plot-boosted Earth Power.

Heatran.overview:
Steel

Heatran is a key Pokemon for Steel teams thanks to Flash Fire's ability to absorb Fire-type attacks such as V-create from Victini. Heatran has excellent typing with decent defensive stats, which contributes to its good special bulk. Heatran also has access to a variety of utility options; Toxic and Lava Plume allow it to cripple bulky Pokemon such as Mantine, Galarian Corsola, and Rotom-W, Taunt allows it to block utility moves like Leech Seed, Stealth Rock, and Recover from slower Pokemon such as Celesteela, Galarian Corsola, and Toxapex, and Stealth Rock lets Ferrothorn dedicate its slot to Spikes. However, Heatran's Fire typing compounds Steel teams' natural weaknesses; it stacks the Ground-type weakness for its team against foes like Garchomp and creates a weakness against Water-types such as Barraskewda. Heatran also has mediocre Speed and is forced to switch out against fast physical threats such as Urshifu-R, Barraskewda, Excadrill, Landorus-T, and Garchomp. Heatran lacks proper recovery and is reliant on Leftovers, which directly affects its longevity during the battle as it doesn't like taking hits from other Pokemon.
Heatran.comments:
Other Options

Fire

Body Press, in tandem with Air Balloon, can be used to offensively check Tyranitar, leaving its teammates such as Volcarona free to set up without issue against Dark teams. Toxic can also be used to cripple Water-type walls such as Gastrodon and Slowking.

Steel

Heatran may opt for a trapper set by using Magma Storm over Lava Plume, allowing it to beat some of its checks such as Toxapex and Galarian Slowking with the help of Taunt. Overheat may be used over Flamethrower on Choice Scarf Heatran to consistently OHKO Zarude and non-Assault Vest Melmetal. However, the Special Attack drop means that Heatran has to always switch out, rendering it unable to clean Grass and Steel teams late-game.

Specially Defensive (Steel).description:
Lava Plume is Heatran's most spammable STAB attack that comes with a 30% chance to burn the foe, which can be used to cripple Toxapex. Earth Power is used mainly for opposing Heatran and hits Toxapex as well as Electric-types such as Alolan Raichu and Tapu Koko. Toxic cripples foes that Heatran cannot reliably beat, like Mantine, Slowbro, and Porygon2. Heatran's excellent typing and natural bulk make it one of the best Stealth Rock setters, as it forces a lot of switches. However, Taunt allows it to be an effective stallbreaker if another teammate is carrying Stealth Rock. A specially defensive spread with a Calm nature gives Heatran a better matchup against foes such as Tornadus-T and Latios. Leftovers mitigates Heatran's lack of natural recovery. Flash Fire is the preferred ability, as it allows Heatran to absorb Fire-type attacks.

Heatran's presence is appreciated by every Steel-type, as it is the only reliable answer to Fire-types such as Victini. Ferrothorn is one of Heatran's best teammates; Heatran can take Fire-type attacks for Ferrothorn, while Ferrothorn can take Water-type attacks for it and threaten Water-types with Power Whip. In addition, Ferrothorn's Spikes synergizes with Lava Plume and Toxic to accrue chip damage on foes, while Taunt from Heatran prevents Defog from foes like Mantine and maintains Spikes. Celesteela, Skarmory, and Corviknight all make good partners for Heatran, as their typing allows them to switch into Ground-type coverage directed at Heatran. Moreover, Celesteela heals Heatran with Leech Seed and helps against checks such as Swampert, Skarmory provides Spikes and Whirlwind for passive damage while Heatran deters Defog with Taunt, and Corviknight's Pressure allows the duo to make better progress against bulky teams. Excadrill removes entry hazards that harm Heatran, as it already has limited recovery. Moreover, Excadrill can absorb Electric-type attacks for Heatran from foes like Choice Specs Tapu Koko, check opposing Heatran, and, with a Choice Scarf set, clean weakened teams. Aegislash takes care of Fighting-type coverage such as Focus Blast from Tapu Lele and Alakazam. Moreover, Toxic + Substitute Aegislash contributes to Heatran's stallbreaking. Bisharp helps Heatran stallbreak with Knock Off, removing crucial items such as Heavy-Duty Boots from Mantine and Pelipper and Eviolite from Porygon2 and Galarian Corsola. Bisharp also contributes to Psychic- and Ghost-type matchups effectively by threatening faster Pokemon such as Victini, Latios, Gengar, and Dragapult with Sucker Punch and getting free Knock Offs against slower Pokemon such as Slowbro, Galarian Slowking, and Galarian Corsola. Assault Vest Melmetal can take a few hits from specially offensive Pokemon that threaten Heatran, such as Tapu Lele. Calm Mind Jirachi can take advantage of Pokemon that Heatran cannot reliably beat, such as Toxapex and Mantine, while also taking on Dragon-types like Kyurem and Hydreigon.

Choice Scarf (Steel).description:
Choice Scarf Heatran functions on Steel as a good lure for normally faster threats like Tapu Koko, Nidoking, and Landorus-T, easing the Electric, Ground, and Flying matchups. Eruption takes advantage of Heatran attacking first, threatening Tapu Koko, non-Choice Scarf Zarude, and Nidoking. Flash Fire-boosted Eruption is hard to check, threatening even walls such as Gastrodon, Galarian Slowking, and Toxapex. Flamethrower is a consistent STAB move in case Heatran gets damaged; it also cleans Grass and Steel teams late-game. Earth Power picks off weakened Fire-types like Cinderace and Victini. Dragon Pulse threatens Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Hydreigon. Flash Cannon is Heatran's best option against Cradily and Fire-neutral Ice-types such as Kyurem and Thick Fat Mamoswine.

Heatran provides a Fire-type immunity for its team and can revenge kill threats like Nidoking and Mamoswine. Substitute + Toxic Aegislash is a good teammate, as it deters Galarian Zapdos, Thundurus-T, and Choice Band Zeraora from using Fighting-type moves. Additionally, it wears down walls such as Mantine and Slowbro for Heatran. Celesteela, Corviknight and Skarmory are immune to Ground-type attacks, which lets them check threats to Heatran such as Excadrill and Garchomp. Ferrothorn deals with Water-types such as Barraskewda and Tapu Fini, chips Garchomp and Landorus-T with Leech Seed, and sets up entry hazards. Excadrill uses Rapid Spin so that Heatran can stay healthy enough to utilize Eruption. Additionally, Excadrill can use Swords Dance + Earthquake to remove Toxapex, one of Heatran's strongest checks. Melmetal checks Zeraora, which is still faster than Heatran, and breaks specially defensive walls such as Chansey and Slowking. Bisharp deals with bulky Pokemon such as Tyranitar, Porygon2, Clefable, and Galarian Slowking while also checking threats such as Dragapult and Swift Swim Barraskewda with Sucker Punch.

Stallbreaker (Fire).description:
Heatran supports Fire teams with its role compression via its distinctive typing and versatile utility. Some of its notable roles are breaking past troublesome walls such as Toxapex, denying entry hazard setters such as Tyranitar and Clefable with Taunt, and setting Stealth Rock. Heatran's typing grants it neutrality to Rock-type attacks from foes such as Choice Scarf Nihilego; it also checks Choice Band Excadrill locked into Earthquake. Air Balloon grants a one-time immunity to Ground-type attacks, which allows it to check Stakataka and Mamoswine. Magma Storm, in conjunction with Taunt, allows Heatran to trap and break through walls such as Toxapex and Chansey, which are otherwise difficult for Fire teams to break through. Earth Power is used to hit opposing Heatran and threats such as Toxapex and Volcanion. Flash Cannon helps Heatran deal with Pokemon such as Tapu Lele, Hydreigon, and Latias.

Heatran's teammates value its ability to switch into Ground-type attacks from Excadrill, Mamoswine, and Landorus-T. Volcarona greatly appreciates Heatran beating walls like Toxapex and opposing Heatran for it to successfully sweep. Cinderace's vast coverage options like High Jump Kick and Zen Headbutt are appreciated, as they aid in defeating Pokemon such as Tyranitar, Kyurem, and Nidoking as well as specially defensive walls like Blissey and Chansey. Choice Scarf Blacephalon is capable of defeating Slowking, which Heatran struggles against, and it appreciates Heatran weakening specially defensive walls with Magma Storm chip damage. Choice Band Victini forms a wallbreaking core with Heatran, as it can do immense damage to threats such as Landorus-T and Excadrill with V-Create as well as pressure troublesome Water-types like Mantine with Bolt Strike. Volcanion is mandatory on Fire teams due to its ability to absorb Water-type attacks from Tapu Fini, Barraskewda, and Azumarill. Additionally, Volcanion is capable of using Defog to get rid of Stealth Rock, which Fire teams are prone to. Moltres is capable of switching into Fighting-type attacks from Galarian Zapdos and Buzzwole while also providing Defog to remove entry hazards. Torkoal allows Heatran to use Flash Cannon over Stealth Rock and boosts Magma Storm with Drought. Incineroar is able to pivot Heatran in with Parting Shot and supports Heatran's wallbreaking ability by removing held items with Knock Off. Its ability to check Tapu Lele and Dragapult is also appreciated

Victini.overview:
Fire

Choice Band Victini is a fantastic sun wallbreaker on Fire teams due to its STAB V-create, which is near impossible to switch into and 2HKOes Fire-resistant walls like Toxapex and Slowbro in sun. Its threat is bolstered by Victini's decent natural Speed, allowing it to threaten nearly all defensive Pokemon. With Bolt Strike, Victini helps Fire in Flying and Water matchups, dealing with slower Flying- and Water-type Pokemon that can handle V-create outside of sun such as Moltres, Mantine, Toxapex, and Slowbro. Victini's ability to generate momentum with U-turn is yet another asset for Fire teams. However, a ton of offensive threats such as Terrakion, Blacephalon, and Zygarde-10% can outspeed and OHKO Victini with their STAB attacks. While V-create is a powerful STAB attack, its resulting stat drops make Victini vulnerable to even more threats such as Mamoswine, Tapu Lele, and Choice Specs Zapdos.
Victini.comments:
Other Options

Fire

Victini can run a Choice Scarf to outspeed threats such as Latios, Zeraora, Choice Band Weavile, and Tapu Koko at the expense of power. It can also use Final Gambit over Trick to catch a Pokemon such as Dragonite off guard. Shuca Berry may be considered in conjunction with Glaciate, as this allows Victini to lure and defeat Dragon Dance Dragonite and Garchomp in a one-on-one, while also defeating threats such as Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan and Landorus-T.

Psychic

Choice Scarf allows Victini to deal with threats such as Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan, non-Choice Scarf Zarude, and Tapu Koko. Heavy-Duty Boots Victini can run a variety of moves over U-turn or Substitute to improve its matchup against certain types. Scorching Sands snipes Heatran, and Will-O-Wisp cripples Sucker Punch users such as Bisharp and switch-ins such as Landorus-T and Hippowdon. Encore locks Pokemon such as Toxapex and Ferrothorn into undesirable moves. Glaciate allows Victini to threaten Flying and Ground teams better due it beating checks such as Landorus-T and Garchomp, Expanding Force threatens Toxapex, and Energy Ball heavily damages Gastrodon and Swampert, allowing Victini to use its coverage to threaten Water teams more freely. However, these more situational options worsen Victini's performance in other matchups. Blue Flare may be used over V-create to circumvent the latter's Speed drop, letting Victini sweep Steel teams much more easily, but Psychic teams highly value V-create due to its physical nature. Brick Break may be used over U-turn on Choice item sets to remove dual screens from types such as Dark and Fairy, as well as 2HKOing Heatran after Stealth Rock damage. However, U-turn is generally preferred.

Checks and Counters

Fire

Super Effective Attacks: Choice Scarf Hydreigon, Gengar, Garchomp, Terrakion, and Barraskewda are examples of Pokemon that outspeed and easily OHKO Victini.

Fire-resistant Pokemon: Since Victini primarily wallbreaks with V-create, Pokemon that resist Fire such as Gastrodon can switch into Victini. However, Victini can always use U-turn to bring in a teammate to deal with them. Pokemon such as Toxapex and Slowbro also can't switch into Bolt Strike or a sun-boosted V-create.

Revenge Killers: Faster strong attackers such as Zeraora, Excadrill in sand, Barraskewda, and Choice Scarf Landorus-T can revenge kill Victini.

Status: Paralysis prevents Victini from outspeeding threats such as Choice Band Urshifu-R and Galarian Moltres, while Toxic poison limits the time Victini has to wallbreak.

Choice Band (Fire).description:
V-create is capable of 2HKOing nearly every Pokemon in the metagame, with the exception of bulky Fire-resistant Pokemon such as Toxapex, Slowbro, and Swampert. However, even they have difficulty switching into it when sun boosted. Bolt Strike targets Water-type Pokemon that resist V-create. U-turn generates momentum for teammates. Trick cripples walls such as Gastrodon by locking them into an attack. Maximum Speed investment alongside a Jolly nature allows Victini to outspeed key threats such as Urshifu-R, Kyurem, and Tapu Lele.

Torkoal powers V-create up with Drought, supports the team with Stealth Rock and Rapid Spin, forces switches for Victini to exploit with Yawn, and uses its physical bulk to check Pokemon like Mimikyu, Weavile, and Zeraora. Cinderace can use High Jump Kick and Sucker Punch to get rid of Rock- and Ghost-types like Tyranitar and Dragapult for Victini, and the pair can wear down shared checks such as Swampert and Rotom-W. Volcarona can break through checks to Victini such as Toxapex, Hippowdon, and Swampert with its Psychic and Giga Drain. Victini can threaten special walls such as Blissey in return. Rotom-H beats Mantine on Flying teams to give Victini freedom to spam V-create, switches into strong Electric-types such as Regieleki and Tapu Koko, and provides support in Defog and dual screens. Heatran uses its Rock neutrality and Dragon resistance to check threats to Victini such as Nihilego and Latias. Choice Scarf Blacephalon appreciates Victini's wallbreaking, allowing it to easily clean late-game. In return, Choice Scarf Blacephalon can take on troublesome Ghost- and Psychic-type Pokemon such as Spectrier, Slowbro, and Choice Specs Latios. Volcanion is a powerful special wallbreaker that can break past physical walls such as Mandibuzz and Toxapex as well as check Azumarill for Victini. Parting Shot Incineroar can form a momentum-generating core with Victini, allowing Fire teams to always keep momentum on their side. Incineroar can also remove items such as Toxapex's Black Sludge with Knock Off and deal with Psychic- and Ghost-type Pokemon. Lightning Rod Alolan Marowak can be used as an emergency source of Electric immunity to prevent threats like Choice Specs Tapu Koko and Regieleki from steamrolling through the type.

Heavy-Duty Boots (Psychic).description:
Victini is the cornerstone of all Psychic teams as an excellent physical attacker that can deal with Steel-types such as Celesteela and Ferrothorn, which Psychic teams struggle with. V-create deals with all Steel-types except Heatran and dents switch-ins such as Landorus-T that aim to take on Victini's coverage moves. Bolt Strike threatens Water-types such as Toxapex and Mantine, and it also chips down Heatran, which helps Victini eventually overpower Steel teams. U-turn allows Victini to pivot out of switch-ins such as Swampert and Slowbro, allowing it to gain momentum for its teammates. Toxic cripples switch-ins such as Swampert and Hippowdon, while Substitute lets Victini take advantage of forced switches and avoid status, allowing it to wear down its checks such as Heatran and become harder to revenge kill. Heavy-Duty Boots gives Victini longevity, especially helping it threaten bulkier types such as Steel and Poison. Maximum Speed EVs with a Jolly nature allow Victini to outspeed and pivot out of threats such as Mimikyu, Landorus-T, and Kyurem.

Slowbro is a great partner for Victini, as it deals with faster Water- and Ground-types such as Barraskewda and Choice Scarf Excadrill that threaten Victini, as well as pivots it in with Teleport. Calm Mind Latios breaks through bulky physical walls such as Hippowdon, Toxapex, and Slowbro for Victini, and it appreciates Victini pressuring Steel-types such as Heatran and Jirachi, which Latios struggles with. Choice Scarf Tapu Lele sets Psychic Terrain to neutralize priority users such as Azumarill and Bisharp, and it also threatens Dark- and Dragon-types such as non-Choice Scarf Weavile and Hydreigon. Hatterene benefits from Victini's ability to remove Steel-types that wall it, and in turn it checks Dark- and Dragon-types such as Galarian Moltes and Kyurem for Victini. Jirachi sets Stealth Rock and slows down the opposing team for Victini with Thunder Wave. Galarian Slowking is a great special wall that can deal with faster threats such as Choice Scarf Blacephalon and Volcarona. Cosmic Power Mew benefits from Victini pressuring Steel-types such as Bisharp and Aegislash, and it acts as a good late-game wincon in matchups such as Ground and Water, which Victini struggles with.

Choice Band (Psychic).description:
With a Choice Band, Victini turns into an effective wallbreaker due to its excellent coverage and Speed tier, 2HKOing even the bulkiest walls in the metagame such as Hippowdon, Toxapex, and Slowbro. V-create is an extremely strong nuke that obliterates all Steel-types except Heatran, and it hits anything that doesn't resist it hard. Bolt Strike threatens switch-ins to V-create such as Heatran, Mantine, and Toxapex, and it OHKOes bulkier variants of Galarian Moltres. U-turn allows Victini to escape unfavorable matchups from switch-ins such as Slowbro and Gastrodon. Trick cripples the aforementioned physical walls, defensive Pokemon such as Heatran and Aegislash, and bulky setup sweepers such as Cosmic Power Mew once Victini's wallbreaking prowess is unneeded.

Choice Band Victini is prone to getting worn down by entry hazards, so teammates that provide entry hazard control such as Latias and Hatterene are greatly appreciated. Latias also deals with faster threats, such as Garchomp, for Victini and provides Healing Wish to give it a second chance to wallbreak. Hatterene can devastate faster teams such as rain Water, Dark, and Electric, which Victini cannot handle, and appreciates Victini's ability to obliterate Steel-types such as Melmetal. Victini paves the way for Choice Scarf Tapu Lele to clean opposing teams late-game, and Tapu Lele also provides Psychic Terrain to neutralize priority users such as Bisharp and Azumarill for it. Galarian Slowking is a strong specially defensive pivot and can support Victini's wallbreaking prowess with Future Sight, heavily pressuring possible switch-ins such as Swampert and Toxapex. Mew and Jirachi provide Spikes and/or Stealth Rock to wear down the opposing team for Victini, and they cripple the opposing team with Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave.

Excadrill.overview:
Ground

Sand Rush alongside its phenomenal Attack stat allows Excadrill to become a potent revenge killer for Ground teams, taking on threats such as Zarude, Keldeo, Barraskewda, and Choice Scarf Tapu Bulu under sand. Excadrill's decent natural bulk allows it to live attacks such as unboosted Galarian Moltres's Fiery Wrath, Choice Specs Dragapult's Shadow Ball, and Hydreigon's Flamethrower. Excadrill's part-Steel typing allows it to take neutral damage from Ice- and Grass-type attacks such as Weavile's Ice Shard and Tapu Koko's Grass Knot and resist Dragon- and Psychic-type attacks such as Latias's Draco Meteor and Psychic. It also has Rapid Spin, which allows Excadrill to clear entry hazards off the field; this gives Ground teams their only and reliable form of entry hazard removal. However, Excadrill relies on sand to outpace most offensive threats such as Choice Specs Zapdos, Victini, Tapu Lele, Blacephalon, and Nidoking, leaving it easily revenge killed outside of sand.

Steel

Excadrill is an effective revenge killer and late-game cleaner for Steel teams, making it extremely valuable in the Electric, Poison, Psychic, and Fire matchups. Its ability, Mold Breaker, is extremely useful, as it allows Excadrill to spam Earthquake without being bothered by Levitate users like Rotom-W and Galarian Weezing. However, Excadrill is slower than most Choice Scarf users and gets forced out by those that carry super effective coverage such as Blacephalon, Tapu Lele, and Galarian Darmanitan. Furthermore, Excadrill struggles to deal with physical walls such as Slowbro and Galarian Corsola, which means that it needs support from teammates like Aegislash and Bisharp to break down certain defensive cores.
Excadrill.comments:
Other Options

Ground

Swords Dance + Rapid Spin can be used on both Sand Rush and Mold Breaker Excadrill. It allows Excadrill to act as a sweeper outside of sand thanks to Rapid Spin allowing it to outspeed Pokemon such as Kyurem. Mold Breaker can be used to target Levitate users such as Rotom-W, Hydreigon, and Latios with Earthquake. A Choice Scarf set can be used on sand less Ground teams to allow Excadrill to act as a revenge killer without the boost from sand or Rapid Spin and take on threats such as Choice Specs Tapu Lele. Shadow Claw can be used to take on Psychic teams, allowing Excadrill to 2HKO Pokemon such as physically defensive Bronzong.

Steel

An Occa Berry or Chople Berry may be used over Leftovers on the Swords Dance set to survive a Fire- or Fighting-type move, allowing Excadrill to lure in and KO Pokemon like Zapdos, Blacephalon, Zeraora, and Thundurus-T, but the lack of Leftovers recovery hurts Excadrill's longevity in other matchups. Shed Shell may also be used over Leftovers to prevent Excadrill from getting trapped by Magnet Rise Air Balloon Magnezone, but it is useless in other matchups. Using these items over Leftovers also allows Excadrill to bluff a Choice Scarf set, which can be favorable in Psychic and Electric matchups, as its Choice Scarf set threatens to outspeed and KO Victini and Zeraora.

Checks and Counters

Ground

Ground-immune and -resistant Pokemon: Pokemon that are immune to or resist Earthquake present a problem to Excadrill. However, Pokemon like Landorus-T, Galarian Moltres, and Zarude have to watch out for its other STAB and coverage moves in Iron Head, Rock Slide, and X-Scissor, respectively. The only Pokemon that truly wall all of Excadrill's coverage are Celesteela, Corviknight, and Skarmory; the former can wall its attacks and wear it down with Leech Seed + Protect, and the latter two can threaten it with Body Press in return.

Physically Defensive Walls: Physically defensive walls such as Rotom-W, Porygon2, Galarian Corsola, and Hippowdon can easily take all of Excadrill's attacks and either cripple it with status or threaten it with their STAB attacks.

Revenge Killers: Revenge killers such as Spectrier, Garchomp, Cinderace, and Choice Scarf Tapu Bulu outspeed and revenge kill Excadrill outside of sand. Dragon Dance Dragapult also only needs one Dragon Dance to outpace Excadrill in sand, and Choice Scarf Weavile outspeeds Adamant Excadrill in sand.

Status: Being burnt severely hinders Excadrill's performance as a wallbreaker, as it can no longer break past defensive Pokemon such as Mandibuzz and Amoonguss or OHKO offensive threats such as Choice Specs Zapdos, even after Stealth Rock. Whimsicott and Zapdos can paralyze Excadrill with Stun Spore and Static respectively, preventing it from outspeeding threats such as Zarude and Zeraora.

Steel

Physically Defensive Walls: Physically defensive Pokemon such as Slowbro, Celesteela, and Hippowdon take minimal damage from Excadrill's attacks and threaten it with their own super effective attacks.

Choice Scarf Users: Faster Choice Scarf users such as Victini, Zarude, and Landorus-T outspeed Excadrill and can OHKO it.

Magnezone: Excadrill has to be wary of getting trapped and KOed by Magnezone in Electric matchups as Excadrill may be forced to lock into Rock Slide to KO Zapdos. Magnezone can even hold an Air Balloon to render Excadrill's Earthquake ineffective. However, Magnezone is less threatening if Excadrill is using a Swords Dance set.

Status: Burn from Galarian Corsola and Scald users like Slowbro severely reduces Excadrill's offensive potential.

Sand Rush (Ground).description:
Earthquake allows Excadrill to take on most Pokemon that are weak or not resistant to Ground-type attacks such as Zeraora, Victini, Ferrothorn, Garchomp, Urshifu-R, and Dragapult. Iron Head targets Ice- and Fairy-types such as Avalugg, Alolan Ninetales, Tapu Bulu, and Tapu Lele. X-Scissor is used to take on Zarude and Celebi while also dealing with other Dark- and Psychic-types such as Hydreigon and Slowbro. Rock Slide targets Flying-types such as Zapdos, Galarian Moltres, and Mantine. Sand Rush allows Excadrill to outspeed threats such as Blacephalon, Zeraora, Zarude, and Choice Specs Dragapult under sand. Maximum Speed investment allows Excadrill to outspeed threats such as Tapu Bulu, Adamant Diggersby, and Choice Specs Pelipper. An Adamant nature paired with a Choice Band allows Excadrill to OHKO threats such as Keldeo after Stealth Rock and 2HKO Slowbro with X-Scissor. A Jolly nature can be used to outspeed threats such as +1 Adamant Dragapult and Choice Scarf Weavile in sand. Excadrill should be safely brought in to take advantage of the sand with methods such as Eject Button Hippowdon or by bringing it on resisted attacks such as Latias's Draco Meteor.

All of Excadrill's teammates appreciate its ability to take on Ice-, Psychic-, and Fairy-types, clear entry hazards with Rapid Spin, and act as a revenge killer in sand against threats such as Barraskewda, Choice Specs Dragapult, and Choice Scarf Tapu Bulu. Hippowdon is a mandatory partner for Excadrill, as it sets sand and Stealth Rock, as well as being able to bring in Excadrill safely with Eject Button. Hippowdon can also take on physical threats such as Dragon Dance Dragapult, Zeraora, and Bisharp for Excadrill. Gastrodon and Seismitoad offer Excadrill an immunity to Water-type attacks such as Mantine's Scald and Barraskewda's Waterfall. Gastrodon offers a more defensive presence thanks to Recover, while Seismitoad checks Azumarill, which would otherwise beat Excadrill. Swords Dance Garchomp wears down shared checks like Celesteela with Fire Fang, takes on Mantine with Stone Edge, and can become dangerous setup sweeper with Scale Shot, which makes handling Pokemon like Spectrier much easier. Landorus-T provides a Ground immunity, allowing it to switch into Hippowdon's Earthquake; it is also a great revenge killer that can take on weakened threats such as Zeraora, Spectrier, and Urshifu-R with its Choice Scarf set. Gravity Landorus-T can threaten Pokemon such as Skarmory, Celesteela, and Corviknight for Excadrill, as well as taking on Steel teams in their entirety if it carries Bulk Up and Substitute. Nidoking can beat Steel-types such as Heatran, Ferrothorn, and Celesteela with Earth Power + Flamethrower or Flying-types such as Mantine, Pelipper, Corviknight, and Dragonite with Thunderbolt + Ice Beam. Mamoswine is a great late-game cleaner that can pick off weakened threats such as Garchomp, Dragapult, and Hydreigon with Ice Shard while also being able to remove items such as Slowking's Heavy-Duty Boots with Knock Off.

Choice Scarf (Steel).description:
Earthquake deals with Fire- and Steel-types, allowing Excadrill to remove threats such as Victini and Heatran. Rock Slide allows Excadrill to threaten Flying-types such as Zapdos and Crobat that switch into Earthquake. Rapid Spin allows Excadrill to remove only the opponent's entry hazards, which synergizes with Steel's tendency to stack entry hazards. Iron Head deals with Fairy- and Ice-types such as Tapu Bulu and Kyurem. Toxic may be used to punish defensive Pokemon like Mew and Slowbro. A Choice Scarf allows Excadrill to outspeed a majority of the metagame and remove threats like Zeraora, Dragapult, and Victini.

Ferrothorn is a good teammate, as it covers Excadrill's weaknesses to Ground and Water by checking Hippowdon and Kingdra and it sets up entry hazards to chip foes. Aegislash provides a Fighting immunity and can punish physically defensive walls such as Slowbro and Mantine with Toxic. Heatran offers a Fire immunity and can trap and remove bulky walls such as Mew and Porygon2 that Excadrill struggles with. Celesteela provides a Ground immunity and threatens Grass- and Steel-types such as Amoonguss and Ferrothorn. Alternatively, Corviknight or Skarmory could be considered as the Ground-immune partner, as they both threaten Fighting-types such as Galarian Zapdos and Kommo-o. Melmetal heavily damages bulky walls such as Amoonguss and Toxapex, which allows Excadrill to clean Psychic and Poison teams late-game. Jirachi threatens physical walls such as Slowbro, Amoonguss, and Celesteela for Excadrill and can wear down Poison and Water teams with its Choice Specs set. Bisharp deals with faster, frailer Pokemon such as Choice Scarf Victini and Blacephalon with Sucker Punch and can break down walls such as Slowbro and Porygon2 with its Swords Dance set.

Swords Dance (Steel).description:
With Swords Dance, Excadrill becomes an effective late-game sweeper for Steel teams, allowing it to break through walls such as Toxapex, Slowbro, and Zapdos, which improves the matchup of Steel teams against Poison, Psychic, and Electric teams. Earthquake deals with Poison- and Steel-types, allowing Excadrill to OHKO bulky Pokemon such as Toxapex and Melmetal after a Swords Dance. Rock Slide allows Excadrill to OHKO threats such as Thundurus-T, Zapdos, and Crobat after a Swords Dance. Iron Head may be considered instead, as it allows Excadrill to clean late-game in the Fairy and Dragon matchup and hit common switch-ins such as Landorus-T harder. Rock Blast can be considered to break the Substitutes of Kyurem and Galarian Moltres, but it is less consistent than Rock Slide. Rapid Spin allows Excadrill to boost its Speed, pick off weakened Pokemon, and take advantage of forced switches, allowing it to outspeed would-be answers such as Victini, Zeraora, and Gengar. Leftovers prolongs Excadrill's longevity, allowing it to set up and threaten opposing teams multiple times in a match.

Ferrothorn checks threats such as Tapu Fini and Hippowdon for Excadrill and sets up entry hazards to chip the opposing team. Specially defensive Aegislash can tank weak special attacks from physically defensive walls such as Slowbro and Porygon2 and punish them with Toxic while also providing a Fighting immunity. Heatran provides a switch-in to Fire-type attacks and can utilize a Choice Scarf set to make up for Excadrill's reduced Speed, allowing it to outspeed and KO threats such as Choice Scarf Tapu Bulu and Victini. Celesteela, Corviknight, and Skarmory provide a Ground immunity and utility in the form of Leech Seed, pivoting, and entry hazards, respectively. Choice Scarf Magnezone can trap and KO opposing Steel-types such as Celesteela, Corviknight, and Skarmory and Water-types such as Urshifu-R and Keldeo, all of which Excadrill struggles with.

Seismitoad.comments:
Other Options

Ground

Toxic may be used over anything but Power Whip to pressure Mantine and Slowbro, and Poison Jab makes Seismitoad a Tapu Bulu lure. Scald is also an option to threaten switch-ins such as Tapu Bulu and cripple Pokemon expecting a setup opportunity like Garchomp and Scizor. Assault Vest may be used over Leftovers to handle special attackers such as Kingdra, Tapu Lele, and Tapu Fini better, but the lack of Leftovers recovery lessens Seismitoad's ability to check threats such as Urshifu-R and Azumarill in the long run.

Offensive (Ground).description:
Seismitoad's ability to outspeed and remove threats such as Belly Drum Azumarill and Crawdaunt gives it a niche as a Water-immune Pokemon for Ground teams. Compared to its main competition, Gastrodon, Seismitoad trades longevity and walling potential for utility, Speed, and offensive presence. Substitute takes advantage of foes locked into a Water-type move such as Choice Scarf Urshifu-R and Choice Band Barraskewda, as well as passive, status-reliant Pokemon such as Rotom-W and Toxapex. Power Whip deals heavy damage to Water-types, notably KOing Azumarill after it has used Belly Drum, Crawdaunt after Stealth Rock damage, and Urshifu-R after a Close Combat Defense drop. Power Whip also deters Calm Mind Tapu Fini and Keldeo from using Seismitoad as setup fodder. Earthquake threatens Poison- and Steel-types such as Toxapex, Dragalge, and Magnezone. Knock Off deals with Ghost-types and removes items from switch-ins such as Tapu Bulu, Zapdos, and Zarude. 104 Speed EVs with an Adamant nature allow Seismitoad to beat Adamant Crawdaunt and Adamant Azumarill, while the defensive investment lets it survive Close Combat from Choice Band Urshifu-R.

Status, especially Toxic, hinders Seismitoad's ability to pivot against predicted Water-type moves from Urshifu-R and Kingdra. This makes Nidoking an excellent teammate, as it absorbs Toxic Spikes. Nidoking also deals with Steel-types such as Ferrothorn and Celesteela and threatens Kommo-o, Tapu Bulu, and Corviknight, which commonly use Seismitoad as setup fodder. Seismitoad's offensive presence makes it a great fit for sand teams, as Choice Band Sand Rush Excadrill appreciates Seismitoad's ability to remove Azumarill and Rotom-W, and in return outspeeds and removes threats such as Kyurem, Zarude, Tapu Bulu, and Tapu Lele. Landorus-T provides a Ground-type immunity and can take Grass-type attacks from Zarude and Choice Specs Jirachi. Mamoswine deals with Flying- and Grass-types such as Galarian Moltres, Zapdos, and Tapu Bulu. It also switches into Freeze-Dry from Alolan Ninetales and Kyurem. In return, Seismitoad switches into Scald from Slowbro and Toxapex. Swords Dance Garchomp pressures Dragon- and Flying-types such as Kyurem, Dragonite, and Corviknight as well.

Swift Swim (Water).description:
Seismitoad is the premier Stealth Rock setter for Swift Swim teams while also providing an Electric-type immunity for the team. Hydro Pump is hard to switch into under rain, and Earth Power is strong Ground-type STAB move for Seismitoad to use. Focus Blast allows Seismitoad to 2HKO Ferrothorn. Grass Knot will enable Seismitoad to take on opposing rain teams with more ease as well as Water-immune Pokemon such as Gastrodon and opposing Seimsitoad, with Hydro Pump being able to take on Ground teams in the rain easily. However, Ferrothorn is harder to break past for the team without Focus Blast. Seismitoad's EV spread allows it to take advantage of the rain to its best ability by being as strong and as fast as possible.

Barraskewda and Gyarados appreciate Seismitoad's ability to set up Stealth Rock as well as help them break past physical walls such as Ferrothorn by wearing them down. Gyarados is also a check to Choice Scarf Gardevoir on rain teams, which poses a considerable threat to Swift Swim Water teams through outspeeding every Pokemon on the type by obtaining Swift Swim through Trace. Furthermore, Barraskewda can take on faster Choice Scarf users such as Terrakion and Gengar under rain. Other wallbreakers such as Keldeo are appreciated as partners as they break down shared checks with Seismitoad and can beat faster Pokemon such as Hydreigon and Indeedee outside of rain. Toxapex is a good partner for Seismitoad as a result of its Grass neutrality as well as its ability to weaken the opposing team by spreading status.

Whimsicott.comments:
Other Options

Grass

Whimsicott can run a Substitute + Leech Seed set, but this set is generally inconsistent due to the opponent's ability to simply switch out. Choice Band and Choice Specs can be run on Whimsicott to cripple walls like Celesteela and Toxapex with Switcheroo and break past foes like Gengar and Galarian Moltres more easily. Infiltrator Whimsicott can get past Kyurem and Hydreigon's substitutes, but this isn't recommended; without Prankster + Encore, Whimsicott cannot lock Speed-boosting sweepers like Volcarona and Dragonite into their setup moves. U-turn can also be run on the utility set over Knock Off or Encore to preserve momentum. Whimsicott can run Sunny Day with Chlorophyll Venusaur as a partner, but this doesn't follow the ideal Grass team structure.

Utility (Grass).description:
The utility provided by Stun Spore, Knock Off, and Encore makes Whimsicott a staple on Grass teams. Stun Spore functions as speed control, paralyzing fast, threatening foes such as Tornadus-T and Choice Scarf Heatran. Encore punishes setup sweepers like Volcarona, Scizor, and Dragonite and status moves from threats like SubRoost Kyurem. Knock Off provides a huge amount of utility, allowing Whimsicott to remove key items from foes like Dragalge, Toxapex, and Celesteela. Moonblast threatens Dark-types that are immune to Prankster, such as Hydreigon and Zarude; it also threatens Dragon- and Fighting-types like Kyurem, Kommo-o, and Bewear. The given EV spread allows Whimsicott to outspeed Choice Specs Gengar and Latios in order to remove their items. The rest of Whimsicott's EVs are spread over Special Attack and HP to make Moonblast as powerful as possible while helping Whimsicott's decent natural bulk. Whimsicott can also opt for an EV spread of 208 HP / 92 SpA / 208 Spe in order to switch into Bulk Up Corviknight's Brave Bird. Heavy-Duty Boots is the preferred item, as Grass teams often lack entry hazard control; however, Pixie Plate can be used to boost the power of Whimsicott's Moonblast, giving it a greater offensive presence.

All of Whimsicott's teammates appreciate its ability to prevent setup sweepers like Volcarona, Clefable, and SubRoost Kyurem from brutalizing the team. Choice Band Rillaboom is a phenomenal teammate for Whimsicott, as it can deal with walls like Toxapex for Whimsicott. In return, Whimsicott can take on Dark- and Dragon-type Pokemon for Rillaboom, such as Galarian Moltres and Kommo-o. Bulk Up Zarude is an excellent teammate for Whimsicott, as Whimsicott can Encore foes like Volcarona which can lead to setup opportunities. Whimsicott can also paralyze foes like Spectrier and Choice Scarf Gengar, allowing Zarude to OHKO them with Darkest Lariat. Ferrothorn not only checks terrifying Ice-types like Weavile and Kyurem for Whimsicott, but it provides Spikes support to make it easier for Whimsicott to defeat foes like Cobalion. Cradily checks special attackers, such as Nidoking, Galarian Slowking, and Choice Scarf Blacephalon, and sets Stealth Rock to wear down foes like Galarian Zapdos so that Whimsicott can KO them. Amoonguss is also a good teammate, as it can absorb Toxic Spikes for the team; it also provides the team with a physical wall capable of dealing with Tapu Bulu and Dragapult.

Sunny Day (Grass).description:
Whimsicott is a staple on Grass teams that rely on the sun, as it is one of the best setters thanks to Prankster and can pivot into its teammates to take advantage of sun with Memento and U-turn. Sunny Day sets up the sun for teammates such as Venusaur, Shiftry, and Celebi to take advantage of. Moonblast allows Whimsicott to nail Dragon-type Pokemon such as Kommo-o and Hydreigon. U-turn allows it to bring in its teammates to take advantage of the sun. Encore prevents Whimsicott from becoming setup bait for sweepers such as Bulk Up Corviknight. Memento does the same thing as U-turn; however, it allows Whimsicott to safely bring in a setup sweeper such as Venusaur with a free opportunity to set up. Heat Rock increases the number of sun turns and Prankster gives Sunny Day and Memento priority. Whimsicott should set up sun multiple times throughout the match, and when it's time for a teammate to sweep or Whimsicott is low on health, it should reset the sun and then give it a setup opportunity with Memento.

Teammates that take advantage of the sun such as Venusaur, Celebi, and Shiftry appreciate Whimsicott's ability to set it up, and all of its teammates appreciate its ability to take on Dragon-type Pokemon thanks to Moonblast. Thanks to the sun, Venusaur and Shiftry's Speed is doubled with Chlorophyll, allowing them to fire off attacks faster and become revenge killers. Weather Ball users such as Venusaur and Celebi especially appreciate the sun, as it makes the move Fire type to nail Steel-type Pokemon such as Corviknight and Ferrothorn. Choice Scarf Virizion acts as a revenge killer that takes on threats such as Choice Scarf Charizard and Choice Scarf Galarian Darmanitan for the team. It also provides a way to take on the most common hail and sand setters in Alolan Ninetales and Tyranitar thanks to its coverage in Smart Strike and Close Combat. Alongside Whimsicott, Ferrothorn makes up the support for weather-based Grass teams as the team's way of setting entry hazards, allowing the teams sweepers to more easily muscle through the opposing team.

Stealth Rock Lead (Dark).description:
Krookodile is a valuable lead for hyper offensive Dark teams thanks to the massive utility options it has to offer for its teammates, notably Stealth Rock and Taunt. Taunt is used to shut down Defoggers such as Mandibuzz and Mantine as well as slower entry hazard setters such as Ferrothorn, Hippowdon, Toxapex, and Skarmory. Knock Off has the benefit of removing items from bulky threats such as Porygon2, Mandibuzz, and Blissey, making them easier to deal with. Earthquake lets it threaten Pokemon such as Torkoal, Klefki, and Cobalion. It also discourages fast sweepers like Volcarona and Scolipede from safely setting up on it and beating the majority of the team. Intimidate is a fantastic ability, as it weakens problematic foes like Terrakion and Zeraora, which can handle Dark-type teams easily with their STAB and coverage moves. Maximum Speed investment with a Jolly nature allows it to outspeed slower foes such as Lucario, Kommo-o, and Rotom-C. Focus Sash lets Krookodile set Stealth Rock without getting OHKOed by powerful attacks such as Moonblast from Jirachi or Focus Blast from Alakazam. It's recommended to lead with Krookodile at the start of match, so it can set up Stealth Rock more efficiently with its Focus Sash intact. Magic Bounce users such as Xatu and Hatterene should also be dealt with before attempting to set up Stealth Rock.

Setup sweepers and wallbreakers such as Dragon Dance Tyranitar, Bulk Up Urshifu-S, Hydreigon, and Bisharp appreciate Krookodile's entry hazard support to wear down the opposing team and its ability Intimidate. Taunt is especially useful because it prevents most Pokemon from setting up entry hazards and defensive threats like Toxapex and Corviknight from fully recovering their health. Bisharp can also handle a huge threat in Hatterene, which deflects Stealth Rock with Magic Bounce. Urshifu-S appreciates Stealth Rock damage on opponents, since it can specifically OHKO Zeraora with Sucker Punch and Hatterene with Wicked Blow after a Bulk Up boost. Drapion's part-Poison typing is very useful, as it can set Toxic Spikes and form a hazard-stacking core with Krookodile. Zarude is helpful against troublesome Water-types such as Keldeo and Primarina, as they are both able to use Substitute and force Krookodile to damage them. Krookodile cannot prevent faster leads such as Ribombee, Galvantula, and Cobalion from setting up entry hazards, so Mandibuzz getting rid of them with Defog is appreciated.

Choice Scarf (Ice).description:
Galarian Darmanitan's tremendous Attack stat bolstered by its ability Gorilla Tactics, along with its decent Speed and coverage options, allows it to serve as an effective sweeper and revenge killer. Icicle Crash allows it to beat Ground- and Dragon-types like Hippowdon and Dragapult. Flare Blitz provides great coverage for Bug- and Steel-types like Frosmoth and Corviknight. U-turn is a solid option for safely bringing in a teammate on a predicted switch. Superpower allows Galarian Darmanitan to OHKO defensive Pokemon like Tyranitar and Snorlax. However, Earthquake serves as great coverage for Aegislash, Toxapex, and Chandelure. Maximum Speed investment with a Jolly nature allows Galarian Darmanitan to Speed tie with opposing Choice Scarf users like Drapion.

With its great Speed tier and offensive presence, Galarian Darmanitan has the flexibility to function as a late-game sweeper or wallbreaker while also being able to provide its team momentum with U-turn. Entry hazard removers such as Avalugg and Galarian Mr. Mime serve as helpful teammates for keeping Galarian Darmanitan healthy throughout a match. Vanilluxe offers Aurora Veil support to bolster Galarian Darmanitan's survivability, especially against Choice Scarf users that outspeed it such as Gengar as well as priority users like Bisharp and Aegislash, while also being able to break through defensive Water-types like Rotom-W and Toxapex with Freeze-Dry. Piloswine and Mamoswine support Galarian Darmanitan with Stealth Rock, allowing defensive checks such as Galarian Corsola and Rotom-W to be slowly worn down into KO range.

Choice Band (Ice).description:
By virtue of the stacked boosts from Choice Band and Gorilla Tactics onto its already amazing Attack stat, Galarian Darmanitan is an obscenely powerful wallbreaker. Icicle Crash is able to destroy walls that don't resist it, like Clefable, and even frailer Ice-resistant Pokemon on the switch-in, such as Crawdaunt. Fire Punch and Flare Blitz serve as coverage to nail Steel- and Ice-types that resist Icicle Crash; the former one is preferred, as it already OHKOes Corviknight and Ferrothorn without recoil damage. However, the latter scores KOs versus Levitate Bronzong, +1 Corviknight, Mamoswine, and Aegislash after contact with King's Shield. Earthquake nails Toxapex and Torkoal and is Galarian Darmanitan's best way to damage Snorlax. U-turn takes advantage of the number of switches Galarian Darmanitan forces, generating momentum for the team while hitting reasonably hard. A Jolly nature is vital to outrun Kommo-o and tie with other base 95 Speed Pokemon such as Indeedee.

Because this Galarian Darmanitan forgoes the Speed boost from Choice Scarf, it becomes vulnerable to faster Pokemon like Hydreigon and Dragapult. Other Choice Scarf revenge killers that can beat them, like Weavile and Galarian Mr. Mime, are, thus, great partners. Entry hazards are also an issue for Galarian Darmanitan, since they reduce its lifespan greatly, especially if it's running Flare Blitz; therefore, Rapid Spin users such as the aforementioned Galarian Mr. Mime and Avalugg are mandatory teammates. Alolan Ninetales provides Aurora Veil support for Galarian Darmanitan, making it more useful against offensive teams by taking hits better and KOing faster, frailer enemies back. Swords Dance Weavile and Cloyster appreciate Galarian Darmanitan's capability to break walls for a late-game sweep. Froslass, Mamoswine, and Piloswine can lay down Spikes and Stealth Rock, respectively, softening defensive Pokemon like Toxapex for Galarian Darmanitan.

Stored Power.description:
Reuniclus acts as an amazing mid- to late-game sweeper thanks to a couple of different factors. Calm Mind plus Iron Defense and reliable recovery make it incredibly hard to break by any team once it starts getting a few boosts. Magic Guard further boosts this combination by making it immune to entry hazards and residual damage, most notably poison, which would otherwise inhibit its entire function. Stored Power is its primary attack, which scales incredibly over time as Reuniclus gains more stat boosts. However, be wary of using Reuniclus, as with Stored Power being its only attack, it cannot do much in a battle without first having some stat boosts and is left walled by any Dark-type. It is important to take advantage of passive Pokemon that do not threaten Reuniclus at all by using it as an opportunity to set up with either Calm Mind or Iron Defense.

As Reuniclus is completely ineffective if there is any Dark-type Pokemon on the opponent's team, it is crucial that Dark-types be eliminated before even attempting to set up with Reuniclus. Therefore, Pokemon such as Hatterene, Gardevoir, and Gallade are all crucial for their STAB Fairy- and Fighting-type attacks to take down opposing Dark-types. Pokemon with Fire-type coverage such as Indeedee also greatly benefit Reuniclus, as they can help take down Steel-types that resist Reuniclus's only attack. Indeedee also provides a Ghost-type immunity, which Reuniclus can struggle to take on before setting up.

Amoonguss.overview:
Grass

Amoonguss is a great pivot for Grass teams because of Regenerator and its defensive typing providing a Bug neutrality and resistances to check physical attackers like Heracross and Azumarill. Furthermore, its Fighting resistance is great because Grass teams have common Fighting weaknesses like Ferrothorn, Cradily, and Zarude. Its Poison typing absorbs Toxic Spikes, which is useful since Grass teams lack a good entry hazard remover. Its access to Spore cripples opposing Pokemon, giving teammates like Zarude and Rillaboom opportunities to come in. Unfortunately, Amoonguss is forced out by Pokemon carrying super effective coverage such as Hydreigon, Zapdos, and Heatran and special attackers like Nihilego, Spectrier, and Kingdra. Furthermore, Amoonguss easily becomes bait for setup sweepers like Galarian Moltres and Volcarona and hazard setters like Klefki and Mew after it has used Spore on a foe already. Finally, it has a hard time making progress against defensive Grass-types like Ferrothorn and opposing Amoonguss.
Amoonguss.comments:
Other Options

Grass

Clear Smog is an option to prevent setup sweepers like Clefable and Tapu Fini from using Amoonguss as setup fodder. Stun Spore slows down fast Pokemon like Latios, Choice Scarf Heatran, and Galarian Zapdos to help offensive teammates like Zarude and Rillaboom revenge kill more easily. A pinch Berry like Occa Berry or Payapa Berry has a use in surviving a Fire- or Psychic-type attack from Cinderace or Tapu Lele, respectively.

Checks and Counters

Grass

Steel-types: Many Steel-types like Celesteela, Heatran, and Melmetal take very little damage from Amoonguss and can retaliate with their respective attacks; however, they don't appreciate switching into Spore.

Dragon types: Kyurem, Choice Specs Dragapult, and Hydreigon can threaten Amoonguss with powerful special attacks. Kyurem and Hydreigon can notably use Substitute and avoid Amoonguss's Spore.

Taunt: Taunt users like Corviknight, Tapu Fini, and Mew can cripple Amoonguss from using status moves. They can also use Amoonguss as setup fodder after using Taunt.

Electric Terrain and Misty Terrain: Electric Terrain and Misty Terrain prevent grounded Pokemon like Alolan Raichu and Klefki from being affected by Spore.

Residual Damage: If Amoonguss isn't wearing Heavy-Duty Boots, it makes it difficult to switch into physical attackers like Excadrill on Steel and Zarude on opposing Grass, both types which are known for stacking Stealth Rock and Spikes. Will-O-Wisp also factors in longevity when switching into attacks.

Defensive Pivot (Grass).description:
Spore allows Amoonguss to cripples many Pokemon to give teammates chances to come in. Sludge Bomb synergizes well with Spore, since it targets Pokemon immune to Spore like the Guardian Deities. Foul Play checks physical attackers like Bisharp and Dragapult that could try using it as setup fodder. Heavy-Duty Boots is used to help with durability, since Grass teams don't run entry hazard removal; however, Black Sludge is an alternative.

All of Amoonguss's teammates, especially its offensive teammates in Zarude and Rillaboom, appreciate its Spore to give them opportunities to come in and ability to absorb Toxic Spikes. Amoonguss forms a defensive core alongside Ferrothorn and Cradily, and both notably can check Ice-types like Kyurem and Alolan Ninetales and provide entry hazard support. Ferrothorn's typing allows it to check Psychic-, Dragon-, and Flying-types such as Tapu Lele, Dragapult, and Dragonite. It also has utilities like Thunder Wave, Toxic, and Knock Off to cripple defensive Pokemon like opposing Ferrothorn and Skarmory that Amoonguss relies on teammates to get rid of. Cradily checks special attackers like Zapdos, Volcarona, and Heatran and Substitute users like Hydreigon, Galarian Moltres, and Togekiss with Rock Blast. Whimsicott checks Fighting-, Dragon-, and Dark-types like Guts Heracross, Dragonite, and Mandibuzz along with Substitute users like Galarian Moltres and Kommo-o. Zarude and Rillaboom gets rid of defensive Steel-types like Ferrothorn and Aegislash thanks to their Fighting + Dark coverage. Zarude checks Psychic-types like Latios and Tapu Lele thanks to its Dark typing, while Rillaboom revenge kills threats like Nihilego, Alolan Ninetales, and Mamoswine for Amoonguss. Zarude notably appreciates Amoonguss's ability to check Fairy- and Fighting-types like Tapu Bulu and Buzzwole.

Defensive Pivot (Poison).description:
Amoonguss is a fantastic defensive pivot for Poison teams thanks to Regenerator and its Grass typing, allowing it to take neutral damage from Ground-type attacks and switch into attacks such as Choice Scarf Excadrill's Earthquake even with Stealth Rock up. Spore allows Amoonguss to put threats such as Diggersby and Excadrill to sleep and avoid becoming set up bait against setup sweepers such as Bisharp. Giga Drain allows Amoonguss to target Ground- and Water-type Pokemon such as Hippowdon, Krookodile, Seismitoad, and Keldeo. Foul Play allows Amoonguss to punish physical setup sweepers such as Swords Dance Scizor and Pokemon weak to Dark such as Dragapult. Stomping Tantrum is an option to punish Salazzle, a pain to face for Poison teams, but it is not good in any other matchup. Synthesis gives Amoonguss a reliable form of recovery and also allows it to switch into Choice Scarf Excadrill through the match continually. Black Sludge gives Amoonguss a form of passive recovery, and Regenerator allows Amoonguss to excel as a defensive pivot. Its EVs and Bold nature allow Amoonguss to avoid a 2HKO from physical attacks such as Choice Scarf Excadrill's Earthquake after Stealth Rock damage.

Toxapex and Amoonguss form the Regenerator core on Poison teams. Toxapex also provides Amoonguss with a switch-in to Fire- and Ice-type attacks from Pokemon such as Charizard and Weavile. In return, Amoonguss can tank Electric-type attacks for Toxapex, such as Zeraora's Plasma Fists. Galarian Weezing can switch into powerful Dragon-type attacks for Amoonguss, such as Hydreigon's Draco Meteor. Galarian Weezing also switches into Ground-type attacks that Amoonguss cannot, such as Choice Band Diggersby's Earthquake, as well as cripple physical attackers such as Terrakion with Will-O-Wisp. Skuntank provides a switch-in to Psychic-type attacks and can check dangerous threats to Amoonguss with Sucker Punch, such as Alolan Raichu and Dragapult. Both can also clear entry hazards for Amoonguss with Defog. Amoonguss can put foes to sleep for Gengar with Spore, allowing Gengar to break through the opposing team more easily. Gengar can, in return, cripple walls for Amoonguss like Toxapex by using Trick, making them near deadweight. Salazzle keeps faster foes in check and can check Pokemon such as Excadrill with Flamethrower, taking the burden off Amoonguss to switch into its Earthquake. Salazzle can also significantly improve the Poison- and Steel-type matchup by crippling foes such as Corviknight and Toxapex with Toxic thanks to its ability Corrosion. Scolipede is a powerful setup sweeper that can break through walls such as Chansey with Megahorn and threaten Psychic teams very effectively thanks to Speed Boost and its ability to OHKO or 2HKO all Psychic-type Pokemon. While not incredibly viable, Toxtricity can take on Flying-type Pokemon such as Corviknight, Mantine, and Mandibuzz with Overdrive, which otherwise wall Amoonguss.

Physically Defensive Wall (Ghost).description:
Jellicent acts as a physical wall on Ghost teams that has the added benefit of being immune to Water-type attacks. Scald allows Jellicent to have an attack that prevents it from becoming passive while also being able to burn foes. Taunt can also be used to cripple slower walls and entry hazard setters such as Toxapex, Ferrothorn, and Hippowdon. Strength Sap allows Jellicent to recover health while also crippling physical attackers by lowering their Attack by one stage. Recover gives Jellicent a more reliable form of recovery, however, it may not heal as much as Strength Sap. Will-O-Wisp allows it to cripple physical attackers such as Excadrill. Hex can be used over it to take advantage of status conditions spread by itself and its teammates. Leftovers gives it access to passive recovery. Its EVs allow it to be as physically bulky as possible.

Jellicent and Galarian Corsola can cripple physical attackers by spreading burns through Will-O-Wisp. Sableye can also take advantage of Prankster, allowing it to check setup sweepers such as Gyarados for Jellicent. All of its offensive teammates appreciate its ability to act as a pivot into strong attacks and widdle down the foe, allowing them to better break through the opponent's team. Aegislash appreciates Jellicent's ability to switch into Fire-type attacks for it, and in return, Aegislash can switch into Grass-type attacks for Jellicent.

Sticky Web (Electric).description:
Galvantula is a fantastic lead because it is one of the few Electric-types with access to Sticky Web and has a high base Speed. Having Sticky Web set up is important for Electric-type teams because it helps against threatening Choice Scarf users such as Weavile, Gengar, and Gardevoir and hinders setup sweepers like Cloyster and Barbaracle. Galvantula is also a good attacker because it can land Thunder consistently thanks to Compound Eyes. Thunder is able to 2HKO common Defoggers such as Galarian Weezing and Rotom-W while also threatening anti-hazard leads such as Xatu. Bug Buzz is used for Pokemon that can tank Thunder such as Hydreigon, Mew, Rotom-C, and Alolan Raichu. String Shot slows opposing Pokemon, which makes it easier for Galvantula's teammates to outspeed and check threatening sweepers, such as Excadrill. Energy Ball can be used instead of String Shot to offer Galvantula coverage against Ground-types such as Gastrodon and Seismitoad. Galvantula should be wary of Magic Bounce users such as Hatterene and Defiant users such as Bisharp, as they can take advantage of Sticky Web. A Timid nature and maximum Speed investment allow Galvantula to outspeed Pokemon such as Mew and Speed tie Cobalion.
